title: KR Floral Color Me 2
content:
This font is free, and it will not embed in a pdf. I used it in inDesign and got this error message when I tried to export the file. I would gladly buy it somewhere (don't know where to find it as a purchase font, but even then, I don't know if it will embed.)  
Could there be something I'm doing that prevents if from embedding?  
Thank you.

KR Floral Color Me 2 : This font could not be embedded due to licensing restrictioins in the font. A substitute font will be used if it supports the glyphs unsed in the restricted font. The PDF will not be created if the glyphs cannot be represented. Will not produce a PDF/X compliant file.
author: Lap

comments.content:
Unusual that a free font has licensing restrictions! Probably InDesign is playing it safe because a permission flag is missing. Contact the designer. Or, since it's a pi font so you're probably not using it for a lot of "text", just convert it to outlines.

hhp

Thanks ….  
I will try to figure out how to communicate with the designer. Not sure how to do that.
